fields.summary: have MSB filter client-side, filter tags as text.

comments.body:
GUI-2050 branch contains the initial work.
Some landing pages work, but there are difference in some facet names compared to what's in the actual object. For instance, a facet may be named "availailblity_zone", but the instance object uses "placement" in the data, so changes like that need to be made.
For cases where we require pre-filters (like aws images), we need some additional work and decisions to make about how to handle that.

For cases where the facet name and the field are not matching, we should change the field name (in the underlying code, not the UI), so that they match. The facet name appears in the URL and should be more human-readable if possible.
In some cases, the value to match the facet is not even shown and most likely not passed to the browser. We'll have to include more data now to allow for facet matching. ([~jloza] we should talk about the impact of this and possibly removing some facets due to extra API calls required to satisfy this requirement).

List of items to handle:
launch config - root_device_type (get from image already fetched) (done)
launch config - scaling_group(s) (done).

instances - scaling_group (done, referenced existing tag)
instances - roles (needs additional API call for each instance to cross-reference via instance profiles)

volumes - any facet selection is cleared from URL after being set. odd and unique to this screen (this problem exists in master, so may not try to fix here)

Big TODO in code, look at all <resources>_json views to remove server-side filtering code.

We really need to discuss client filtering for the images page. It's not a big deal for Eucalyptus, but on AWS, we handle different sub-sets of images to prevent us from fetching a really huge set of public images. We load, aws marketplace or amazon owned images, and those are pretty much mutually exclusive. Then, we also fetch images owned by or executable by the user. So, there is no single set of images we could fetch once that would let us rely totally on client filtering, unless we grabbed all 3 sets all the time (for aws). I'll rig up pulling all 3 sets and report back some load times (initial and cached).
From us-east, I loaded those image sets and it took 1m50s for the browser to get the 7365 images.
Reading from cache, those images took 6 seconds to get to the browser.

Removing the aws-marketplace images, we get to:
30 seconds to get 1170 images to the browser
from cache, < .5 second to get those images.

discussion needed.

some discussion was had. Here's the outcome.
The image list on most euca clouds is small enough (even if a couple of hundred) that our existing list/filtering is acceptable.
The lists of images on AWS are just so huge that the time to fetch them is large and the way they are presented is not particularly useful. When you have 1000+ images, it is super un-likely there will be anything found without filtering/searching.
We show the subset (amazon images) by default and w/ caching, that can load fast enough. Perhaps for the scope of this ticket, if we could maintain the existing filtering, that would be fine.

We'll create another ticket to cover a re-think of how we handle aws images. We may need to brainstorm and think differently. GUI-2240
SmartRefresh needs to be taken into account.
[~dkavanagh]: Hmm, seems smart refresh may be a blocker to move to purely client-side filtering.  Should we reconsider implementing this or perhaps mark it as wontfix?

[~kgill], I'm not sure why you see this as a blocker. For the most part, I assume smart-refresh would simply pull the whole data set, which is the default view in most cases. The only way to improve smart-refresh is to pull only those items that re in transition, and that's somewhat independent of this ticket.

[~dkavanagh] Ah, ok, thanks for clarifying.  I'm not sure how we could pull only the items that are in transition without major refactoring.  So could you explain what changes are needed to account for smart refresh?

I'd be happy to code review this whole thing, but in a nutshell, the changes mean facet changes no longer trigger a fetch, but smart-refresh still does, so when new data comes in, the facets/filters are still applied. It worked well when testing on a snapshot that was pending.

[~jloza], I've taken care of all of the facets that didn't work w/ client-side filtering except for one mentioned above:
instances - roles facet
When we filter on the server side, it's only on-demand and we must make an additional API call for each role to get the instance profile, which lists the instances that have this role.
For client-side filtering, we'd need to do this lookup for all roles, not just those specified by a facet, so that's additional API calls(s) for every time this landing page is refreshed. Not a big deal for zero or a very low number of roles, but 1 or more roles and you're adding 1 API call per role to have this facet supported. (calls = time).
Let's consider if we want to keep this facet.
hi [~dkavanagh], I would expect there not to be any externally-visible changes as a result of this ticket, what do you need me to review? I thought this was only change to underlying implementation.
Well, my last comment needs discussion. Ping me when you're free.
hi [~dkavanagh], I'd like to keep the facet, there's definitely a use case for it. Can we have that one facet filter server-side?
Mixing would be a nightmare.
Kicking back because [~dkavanagh] had an idea in the shower about lazy loading to improve load time and still keep this facet. Good luck! Thanks!
nothing visual.. added role facet functionality on instances page per [~jloza]
Punting back to fix issues noted in PR comments
updated w/ suggestions and merged master.
PR 1718 merged
[~dkavanagh]: I don't see tags available as facet options on the instances landing page.  Please advise.
MSB appears to filter client-side, but landing pages are missing tag facets (see ticket title).

[~jloza], I seem to remember a conversation (which isn't captured here) about tag facets and changes required for those being more than we wanted to do. We do support text filtering on tags, which I've tested on instances, volumes and snapshots.

Hi [~dkavanagh], I think we left that conversation as "to be investigated to see if we can do it as designed, and text search in the meantime." We can merge this without that work and then try to revisit this issue for 5.0 under a different bug, that would be OK with me. Thanks!
OK, I'll write an improvement ticket and change this title, then pass it back for QA.

Verified MSB facets filter client-side, observed by watching for XHR calls when adding/removing facets on various landing pages (instances, volumes, snapshots).

Verified on: shared setup (region-two)
Console: https://g-05-03.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com
Account: kamalgill/admin
Tested on: Chrome (incognito mode) Version 51.0.2704.84 (64-bit)
Tested on: IE 11 on Windows 8.1 (Version 11.0.9600.18350)
Release: 0.9504.210.git4629c96.el7

Note that GUI-2718 has been filed to track an issue with removing a text facet
